name: standard
posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

example.eg: This essay is not of an acceptable standard - do it again.
example.egtrans: 这篇文章未达标准——重新写。

example.eg: This piece of work is below standard/is not up to standard.
example.egtrans: 这项工作做得不合要求。

example.eg: We have very high safety standards in this laboratory.
example.egtrans: 我们这个实验室有很高的安全标准。

example.eg: Not everyone judges success by the same standards - some people think happiness is more important than money.
example.egtrans: 每个人衡量成功的标准不尽相同——有些人认为快乐比金钱更重要。

example.eg: Her technique became a standard against which all future methods were compared.
example.egtrans: 她的技术成了后来所有方法的参照标准。

trans_examp.trans_en: a moral rule that should be obeyed

example.eg: Most people agree that there are standards (of behaviour) that need to be upheld.
example.egtrans: 大多数人认同人们需要遵守一定的（行为）准则。

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a pattern or model that is generally accepted

example.eg: This program is an industry standard for computers.
example.egtrans: 这一程序是计算机的一个行业标准。

trans_examp.trans_en: a song or other piece of music that has been popular and often played over a long period of time
trans_examp.trans_cn: （经常演唱或演奏的）常规曲目，保留曲目

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a car with gears that are changed by hand

dsense.name: standard
dsense.posTip: A word that refers to a person, place, idea, event or thing.

trans_examp.trans_en: a flag, especially a long, narrow one ending with two long points
trans_examp.trans_cn: 旗；（尤指）末端有两个尖的窄长旗

name: standard
posTip: A word that describes a noun or pronoun.

trans_examp.trans_en: usual rather than special, especially when thought of as being correct or acceptable

example.eg: White is the standard colour for this model of refrigerator.
example.egtrans: 白色是这种型号的冰箱的标准色。

example.eg: These are standard procedures for handling radioactive waste.
example.egtrans: 这些是处理放射性废料的标准程序。

example.eg: The metre is the standard unit for measuring length in the SI system.
example.egtrans: 米是国际单位制中衡量长度的标准单位。

example.eg: Your new TV comes with a two year guarantee as standard.
example.egtrans: 你的新电视机按照行业规范带有两年的保修服务。

trans_examp.trans_en: Language described as standard is the form of that language that is considered acceptable and correct by most educated users of it

example.eg: Most announcers on the BBC speak standard English.
example.egtrans: 英国广播公司的大多数播音员说的都是标准英语。

example.eg: In Standard American, "gotten" is used as a past participle of "get".
example.egtrans: 在规范的美国英语中，get 的过去分词为 gotten。

trans_examp.trans_en: A standard book or writer is the one that is most commonly read for information on a particular subject

example.eg: Her book is still a standard text in archaeology, even though it was written more than 20 years ago.
example.egtrans: 虽然她的著作成书于20多年前，但时至今日仍被奉为考古学的权威读本。
